background: A clinic has two methods for vaccine administration: a pill and a shot. They are subject to administration time and a minimum ratio of shots to pills.
constraints: The clinic must administer at least RatioShotsToPills times as many shots as pills
The clinic must administer at least MinPills pill vaccines
The clinic operates for a total of TotalTime minutes
Number of pill vaccines administered is non-negative
Number of shot vaccines administered is non-negative
objective: Maximize the number of patients vaccinated
description: A clinic administers two vaccines available for the public to take one at a time. One vaccine is taken as a pill and another is taken as a shot. The pill vaccine takes \param{PillTime} minutes to administer while the shot takes \param{ShotTime} minutes to administer. Since the shot has been more thoroughly studied, the clinic must deliver at least \param{RatioShotsToPills} times as many shots as pills. In addition, the clinic must administer at least \param{MinPills} pill vaccines. If the clinic only operates for \param{TotalTime} minutes, maximize the number of patients that can be vaccinated.

parameters.definition: Time taken to administer the pill vaccine
Time taken to administer the shot vaccine
Minimum ratio of shots to pills
Minimum number of pill vaccines to be administered
Total operating time of the clinic in minutes
